dt: {bc}offensive to the senses and especially to the sense of smell

pt: {sc}malodorous{/sc} {sc}stinking{/sc} {sc}fetid{/sc} {sc}noisome{/sc} {sc}putrid{/sc} {sc}rank{/sc} {sc}fusty{/sc} {sc}musty{/sc} mean bad-smelling. {sc}malodorous{/sc} may range from the unpleasant to the strongly offensive.
{sc}stinking{/sc} and {sc}fetid{/sc} suggest the foul or disgusting.
{sc}noisome{/sc} adds a suggestion of being harmful or unwholesome as well as offensive.
{sc}putrid{/sc} implies particularly the sickening odor of decaying organic matter.
{sc}fusty{/sc} and {sc}musty{/sc} suggest lack of fresh air and sunlight, {sc}fusty{/sc} also implying prolonged uncleanliness, {sc}musty{/sc} stressing the effects of dampness, mildew, or age.

pt.t: the {it}musty{/it} odor of a damp cellar

et: Middle English {it}noysome{/it}, from {it}noy{/it} annoyance, alteration of {it}anoi{/it}, from Anglo-French {it}anui{/it}, from {it}anuier{/it} to harass, annoy {ma}{mat|annoy|}{/ma}
shortdef: offensive to the senses and especially to the sense of smell
